recipe_text: Quantity; 680; Prepare 680 grams of chicken breast, cut into strips| Measurement; 30; Measure out 30 grams of soy sauce| Measurement; 120; Measure out 120 grams of peanut butter| Measurement; 30; Measure out 30 grams of honey| Measurement; 15; Measure out 15 grams of rice vinegar| Measurement; 15; Measure out 15 grams of sesame oil| Measurement; 10; Measure out 10 grams of garlic, minced| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of ginger, minced| Measurement; 2; Measure out 2 grams of red pepper flakes| Quantity; 4; Prepare 4 green onions, sliced| Quantity; 1; Prepare 1 lime, cut into wedges| Untimed; None; In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, peanut butter, honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, and red pepper flakes| Untimed; None; Add chicken strips to the mixture and toss to coat| Untimed; None; Heat a skillet over medium heat| Untimed; None; Add the chicken and cook until no longer pink in the center| Timed; 600; Cook the chicken for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally| Untimed; None; Garnish with green onions and lime wedges| Finish; None; Serve hot!
title: Thai Peanut Chicken
